page.title: 17The Village Magazine
page.content: The Hatfield Heath Village Magazine is printed monthly and is delivered by local people on a voluntary basis. The cost is 15p and is usually paid on an annual subscription. The magazine contains many different items and includes a diary of what is going on in the village and reports written by local organisations on their activities and forthcoming events. Local businesses such as the Post Office, pubs and butchers advertise their services. The village school also produce a magazine twice a year called, "Blots and Jots", which includes stories, poems, drawings, jokes, puzzles and reports on trips and matches. There is work published from the very youngest children in the school to the oldest in our class.
